content:
ECDsaCng Class

Definition

Provides a Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).

In this Article

public sealed class ECDsaCng : System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa
Inheritance
Object
AsymmetricAlgorithm
System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa
ECDsaCng

Inherited Members

Equals(Object,Object)

SignatureAlgorithm

VerifyData(Byte[],Byte[],HashAlgorithmName)

Remarks

This class derives from the ECDsa abstract base class.

Constructors

ECDsaCng()

Initializes a new instance of the ECDsaCng class with a random key pair.

public ECDsaCng ();
Exceptions
PlatformNotSupportedException

Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) classes are not supported on this system.

Remarks

The random key pair has a public key length of 521 bits.

ECDsaCng(Int32)

Initializes a new instance of the ECDsaCng class with a random key pair, using the specified key size.

public ECDsaCng (int keySize);
keySize
Int32

The size of the key. Valid key sizes are 256, 384, and 521 bits.

Exceptions
PlatformNotSupportedException

Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) classes are not supported on this system.

CryptographicException

keySize specifies an invalid length.

Remarks

The random key pair will have the public key length defined by the keySize parameter.

ECDsaCng(CngKey)

Initializes a new instance of the ECDsaCng class by using the specified CngKey object.

public ECDsaCng (System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey key);
key
CngKey

The key that will be used as input to the cryptographic operations performed by the current object.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

key does not specify an Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA) group.

ArgumentNullException

key is null.

PlatformNotSupportedException

Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) classes are not supported on this system.

Properties

HashAlgorithm

Gets or sets the hash algorithm to use when signing and verifying data.

public System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm HashAlgorithm { get; set; }
Value
CngAlgorithm

An object that specifies the hash algorithm.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value is null.

Remarks

This property accepts the following algorithms: MD5, Sha1, Sha256, Sha384, and Sha512.

Other custom hash algorithms may also be used.

The default algorithm is Sha256.

This property is not used if you are signing or verifying data that is already hashed.

Key

Gets or sets the key to use when signing and verifying data.

public System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey Key { get; }
Value
CngKey

An object that specifies the key.

Methods

protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);
disposing
Boolean

To be added.

FromXmlString(String)

This method is not implemented.

public override void FromXmlString (string xmlString);
xmlString
String

The XML-based key information to be deserialized.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

This method was not overridden for this instance.

Remarks

To deserialize an XML key, use the FromXmlString(String,ECKeyXmlFormat) overload instead.

FromXmlString(String,ECKeyXmlFormat)

Deserializes the key information from an XML string by using the specified format.

public void FromXmlString (string xml, System.Security.Cryptography.ECKeyXmlFormat format);
xml
String

The XML-based key information to be deserialized.

format
ECKeyXmlFormat

One of the enumeration values that specifies the format of the XML string. The only currently accepted format is ECKeyXmlFormat.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

xml is null.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

format specifies an invalid format. The only accepted value is ECKeyXmlFormat.

CryptographicException

All other errors.

SignData(Byte[])

Generates a signature for the specified data.

public byte[] SignData (byte[] data);
data
Byte[]

The message data to be signed.

Returns
Byte[]

A digital signature for the specified data.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

data is null.

CryptographicException

The key information that is associated with the instance does not have a private key.

Remarks

This method generates a signature for the specified data by hashing the input data using the HashAlgorithm property, and then signing the result.

The System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags flag is required if the Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) key is not randomly generated by the ECDsaCng object.

SignData(Stream)

Generates a signature for the specified data stream, reading to the end of the stream.

public byte[] SignData (System.IO.Stream data);
data
Stream

The data stream to be signed.

Returns
Byte[]

A digital signature for the specified data stream.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

data is null.

CryptographicException

The key information that is associated with the instance does not have a private key.

Remarks

This method generates a signature for the specified data stream by hashing the input data using the HashAlgorithm property, and then signing the result.

The System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags flag is required if the Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) key is not randomly generated by the ECDsaCng object.

SignData(Byte[],Int32,Int32)

Generates a digital signature for the specified length of data, beginning at the specified offset.

public byte[] SignData (byte[] data, int offset, int count);
data
Byte[]

The message data to be signed.

offset
Int32

The location in the string at which to start signing.

count
Int32

The length of the string, in characters, following offset that will be signed.

Returns
Byte[]

A digital signature for the specified length of data.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

data is null.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

count or offset caused reading outside the bounds of the data string.

CryptographicException

The key information that is associated with the instance does not have a private key.

Remarks

This method generates a signature for the specified data by hashing the input data using the HashAlgorithm property, and then signing the result

The System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags flag is required if the Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) key is not randomly generated by the ECDsaCng object.

SignHash(Byte[])

Generates a signature for the specified hash value.

public override byte[] SignHash (byte[] hash);
hash
Byte[]

The hash value of the data to be signed.

Returns
Byte[]

A digital signature for the specified hash value.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

hash is null.

CryptographicException

The key information that is associated with the instance does not have a private key.

Remarks

The System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags flag is required if the Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) key is not randomly generated by the ECDsaCng object.

ToXmlString(Boolean)

This method is not implemented.

public override string ToXmlString (bool includePrivateParameters);
includePrivateParameters
Boolean

true to include private parameters; otherwise, false.

Returns
String

Not applicable.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

This method is not implemented.

Remarks

To convert the current key to an XML representation, use the ToXmlString(ECKeyXmlFormat) overload instead.

ToXmlString(ECKeyXmlFormat)

Serializes the key information to an XML string by using the specified format.

public string ToXmlString (System.Security.Cryptography.ECKeyXmlFormat format);
format
ECKeyXmlFormat

One of the enumeration values that specifies the format of the XML string. The only currently accepted format is ECKeyXmlFormat.

Returns
String

A string object that contains the key information, serialized to an XML string according to the requested format.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

format specifies an invalid format. The only accepted value is ECKeyXmlFormat.

CryptographicException

All other errors.

VerifyData(Byte[],Byte[])

Verifies the digital signature of the specified data.

public bool VerifyData (byte[] data, byte[] signature);
data
Byte[]

The data that was signed.

signature
Byte[]

The signature to be verified.

Returns
Boolean

true if the signature is valid; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

data or signature is null.

Remarks

This method generates a signature for the given data by hashing the input data using the HashAlgorithm property, and then signing the result.

VerifyData(Stream,Byte[])

Verifies the digital signature of the specified data stream, reading to the end of the stream.

public bool VerifyData (System.IO.Stream data, byte[] signature);
data
Stream

The data stream that was signed.

signature
Byte[]

The signature to be verified.

Returns
Boolean

true if the signature is valid; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

data or signature is null.

Remarks

This method hashes the input data by using the HashAlgorithm property before verification.

VerifyData(Byte[],Int32,Int32,Byte[])

Verifies a signature for the specified length of data, beginning at the specified offset.

public bool VerifyData (byte[] data, int offset, int count, byte[] signature);
data
Byte[]

The data that was signed.

offset
Int32

The location in the data at which the signed data begins.

count
Int32

The length of the data, in characters, following offset that will be signed.

signature
Byte[]

The signature to be verified.

Returns
Boolean

true if the signature is valid; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

offset or count is less then zero.

-or-

offset or count is larger than the length of the byte array passed in the data parameter.

ArgumentNullException

data or signature is null.

Remarks

This method hashes the input data by using the HashAlgorithm property before verification.

VerifyHash(Byte[],Byte[])

Verifies the specified digital signature against a specified hash value.

public override bool VerifyHash (byte[] hash, byte[] signature);
hash
Byte[]

The hash value of the data to be verified.

signature
Byte[]

The digital signature of the data to be verified against the hash value.

Returns
Boolean

true if the signature is valid; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

hash or signature is null.
